NAME: Pranay Wankhede
ABOUT: Experienced Software Engineer with a demonstrated history of building products from scratch. Skilled in algorithms and data structures and cloud computing.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Statistical Analysis of Stressors in Driving Simulation Data
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
- Performed various types of test like ANOVA and t-test on the simulation data to verify that whether there was a significant impact of the stressors or not on the driving performance.
- Performed cleaning of the data prior to applying tests and also checked the assumption required to be fulfilled prior to performing tests like t-test or ANOVA.
- Plotted the results of the assumptions and the tests successfully to draw accurate inferences.
- Language Used : R

- Developed significant feature for eQube-BI 7.0 which involved mining data from different excel sheets and determining primary key, foreign key, relations between two excel sheets.
- Reduced processing time for finding the relations between excel sheets by 30%.
- Technologies: Java, Spring MVC

- eCommerce Web Application developed on the lines of Amazon.com for buying and selling of products online. 
- Technologies :- Java, JSP, Java Script, Oracle 10g.
As a part of Software Design class designed a standalone program in Java to check for rate of currency below or above the user given rate. Implemented Singleton and Null Object Pattern.

- A fully functional web browser with tabbed browsing, session handling, bookmarks and all basic web browsing functionalities designed and implemented in Java. 
- Appreciated for an innovative design with most recent website links in a separate pane.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Hidden Markov Model Part of Speech Tagging
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
- Designed and Implemented Hidden Markov Model Part of Speech Tagger from scratch to tag a corpus consisting of 60k tokens.
- Programmed in Python to handle ambiguous tags for a token and implemented the Viterbi algorithm to beat the baseline results by a margin of 7%.

- Significant feature released in eQube-BI 6.10 to make the product usable by a non-technical user.

- Designed and Implemented UI using Backbone.js.
- Performed code reviews for peers
- Technologies: Java, Spring MVC, JavaScript, JQuery, Backbone.js, Marionette.js, Kendo framework

- This proof of concept was demonstrated at the Gartner's BI Summit 2016 and PLM World 2016.
- Served as a Team Lead of 5 member server side team.
- Researched and Implemented iterative proof of concepts over the year and solved one of the most important case of Costed BOM during this process, which was the highlight at PLM World 2016.

- Designed and implemented Suggester for giving suggestions to the user and thus reducing 
Keystrokes by 40%.
